gold_answer: Yes. You are correct! The VA is a federal department of the United States government.

retrieved_contexts.text:
Business Resources - U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs
VA Federal Supply Schedule (FSS)VA manages multiple award contracts for medical equipment, supply, pharmaceutical, and service Schedule programs.
Forecast of Contracting OpportunitiesThis forecast represents VA’s best estimate of procurement opportunities during the fiscal year.
VA Acquisition Regulations (VAAR)Our supplement of the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR). 
Construction and Facilities Management (CFM)CFM provides a wide variety of services and expertise to VA to deliver high quality and cost-effective facilities in support of our Veterans.
Enhanced-Use Lease (EUL)CFM provides a wide variety of services and expertise to VA to deliver high quality and cost-effective facilities in support of our Veterans.
VA PathfinderAn interactive website to guide you through working and innovating with VA.
Visit PathfinderNon-VA ResourcesThese additional resources our outside VA and are helpful to the business process
System for Award ManagementA government-wide portal used by the Federal government in conducting the acquisition and financial assistance processes.
Procurement Technical Assistance Program (PTAP)PTAP is a network of procurement professionals working to help local businesses compete.

 
 

 We’re here anytime, day or night - 24/7

If you are a Veteran in crisis
 or concerned about one, connect with our caring, qualified responders for confidential help. Many of
 them are Veterans themselves. 

 Call 988 and press
 1
 Text to 838255
 Chat confidentially now
 Call TTY if you
 have hearing loss 1-800-799-4889

Get more resources at VeteransCrisisLine.net. 

Official website of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs

ml.tokens.model_text:
|user|: Can you summarize the types of services?
|assistant|: The types of services include commodity services such as fuel, vehicles, office supplies, and food; service services like elevator maintenance; and technology services including hardware, software, telecommunications, and IT services.
|user|: process for contractor
|assistant|: The document does not provide specific information on the process for becoming a contractor with the Office of General Services.  It would be beneficial to visit the OGS website and explore the Procurement section for more detailed information on becoming a contractor. For the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, the document mentions the VA Federal Supply Schedule (FSS) for medical equipment, supply, pharmaceutical, and service Schedule programs, as well as the Forecast of Contracting Opportunities and VA Acquisition Regulations (VAAR). To become a contractor with the VA, it would be advisable to review these resources and consider contacting the VA directly for further guidance.
|user|: Is VA using a seoparate procurement tool from OSG?
|assistant|: While the VA has its own procurement resources, the OGS has centralized statewide contracts, a Purchaser Notification Service (PNS), the 1122 Program, and other procurement resources. It is possible that they use different systems for procurement, but the document does not provide a direct comparison or confirmation of this.
|user|: Of course VA is federal !!

retrieved_contexts.text:
Buyer Information | Office of General Services
Become an Authorized User
If you are, among others, a state agency, a public authority or benefit corporation, a local government or political subdivision, a volunteer organization (such as ambulance services & fire companies), or a registered charitable organization, you may be eligible to use OGS centralized statewide contracts. Contracts are divided into three types:

Commodity (e.g., fuel, vehicles, office supplies, and food)
Service (e.g., elevator maintenance)
Technology (e.g., hardware, software, telecommunications, and IT services)

For local governments and other government organizations, including schools and public authorities, no additional paperwork beyond your purchase order is needed. If you don’t have an authorized user identification number, we ask that you complete a simple eligibility application. This will provide assurances to companies that you are eligible to use state contracts.

Apply

Procurement Resources

 

 Purchaser Notification Service (PNS)
 
 Register for OGS centralized contract email updates.

 

 1122 Program
 

 Purchase equipment for counter-drug, homeland security, and emergency response.

 

 Conducting Your Own Procurement
 

 Informational resources and templates for conducting your own procurement.

 

 New York State Vehicle Marketplace
 

 Purchase or lease of new Class 1 - 8 vehicles.

 

 New York State Preferred Sources
 

 Preferred Source offerings, guidelines and related information.

 

 File Requirements Online
 

 Milk, salt, and certain fuels.

What's Happening

From business outreach and training to community events, find out what's going on at the Office of General Services.

retrieved_contexts.text:
VA.gov Home | Veterans Affairs
VA.gov Home | Veterans Affairs

Skip to Content

An official website of the United States government

Here’s how you know

The .gov means it’s official.

 Federal government websites often end in .gov or .mil. Before sharing sensitive information, make sure you're on a federal government site.
 

The site is secure.
 The https:// ensures that you're connecting to the official website and that any information you provide is encrypted and sent securely.
 

Talk to the Veterans Crisis Line now

 Welcome to VA.gov

 The PACT Act and your VA benefits
 

 This new law expands and extends eligibility for care and benefits for Veterans and survivors related to toxic exposures.
 

 Learn what the PACT Act means for you
 

 Create an account to manage your VA benefits and care in one place — any time, from anywhere.
 

 Search
 

 Other search tools
 

 Top pages
 

VA
 NEWS

 VA’s mission to better serve all

 Building equity and ending harassment for underserved populations.
 
 
 Read the full article
 
 about VA’s mission to better serve all
 

More VA news
 

 Explore VA benefits and health care
 

Apply for VA health care, find out how to access services, and manage your health and benefits online.

File a claim for disability compensation for conditions related to your military service, and manage your benefits over time.

Apply for and manage your GI Bill and other education benefits to help pay for college and training programs.

Apply for vocational rehabilitation services, get support for your Veteran-owned small business, and access other career resources.

Apply for monthly payments for wartime Veterans and survivors with limited or no income who meet certain age and disability requirements.

Find out if you're eligible for a VA-backed home loan. If you have a service-connected disability, see if you qualify for a housing grant to help you live more independently.

Explore VA life insurance options for Veterans, service members, and families. Manage your policy online, file claims for benefits, and access helpful resources.

Get help planning a burial in a VA national cemetery, order a headstone or other memorial item to honor a Veteran's service, and apply for survivor and dependent benefits.
